title: "What is the nature of our thoughts and how can we achieve true renunciation?"
first_phrase: In this concluding section, the author reflects on the nature of the mind and its effect on one's identity. They emphasize that thoughts are not personal and that the key to freedom lies in renouncing attachment to the "I" or "mine." The author draws from their experiences in India to illustrate the persistence of the mind's tape and the illusory nature of the self. Through this, the author invites the reader to question their own identification with their thoughts and to seek liberation.
content: The difference between the mind and my mind is very subtle. If you were to say "my mind," the assumption is that you are solid, and it belongs to you. Rather, there is the mind and there are thoughts. In this way it becomes easier not to fuse with thoughts. East Indian literature says that the key to freedom lies in renunciation. What do we mean by renunciation? Do you have to give up your desires or your feelings? No, but you have to give up your identification with the "I", "me" and "mine." This is true renunciation. In the same way, you have to give up identification with the mind (condensed VOID). The most important thing to understand is that the "I" will always run its tape. After I had lived in India for 5 years, people would leave and return but I'd still be there. After 6 years, someone came up to me and said, "You're going to be here forever" (as if l were someone special). "Actually, I'm leaving in June" I said.
last_phrase: Ultimately, renouncing identification with the mind is the key to freedom. Understanding the subtle difference between the mind and "my" mind can help you not to fuse with thoughts. When you give up identification with the "I," "me," "mine," and the mind, you can experience true renunciation. Even thoughts that seem positive, like "I love God" or "I want to do service," are still "I" thoughts. Thus, letting go of identification with the mind can help you break free from the ego's hold and experience true liberation.
